intro: Tauroceras cornigerum, commonly known as the horned milkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the Apocynaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive horn-like structures on its leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Tauroceras cornigerum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
